newsitem.title: FRANCE: Hunger strike French ex-mayor taken to hospital.
newsitem.headline: Hunger strike French ex-mayor taken to hospital.

text.p: The ex-mayor of the French Riviera resort of Cannes was taken to hospital on Friday as he continued a six-day-old hunger strike to press for his release from 10 months in pre-trial custody, medical sources said.

Michel Mouillot, of the centre-right Union for French Democracy party, was detained last July after being placed under investigation over accusations he solicited bribes in exchange for permits to install one-arm bandits in a hotel casino.
Hospital sources said he refused to eat and drink and rejected any medical test.

"There is no other example of such long pre-trial custody in political corruption cases," Mouillot's lawyer Francois Saint-Pierre said earlier this week when it became known his client had gone on a hunger strike for several days.

Mouillot resigned as mayor in February after the Supreme Court upheld an 18-month prison sentence he was given in a separate case for receiving a fictitious salary from a Lyon businessman. He was also barred from holding public office for five years.
